Only regenerates if quality is below threshold for your document type. Specialized in neural network architectures, system diagrams, flowcharts, biological pathways, and complex scientific visualizations.

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate scientific diagram generation tool. It makes API calls to OpenRouter (a known AI service) for image generation, writes files to user-specified paths, and reads only the OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable. No malicious patterns, no credential theft, no persistence mechanisms, and no data exfiltration to unknown endpoints.

content.value_statement: Creating scientific diagrams manually is time-consuming and requires design skills. This skill uses AI to generate publication-quality diagrams from natural language descriptions. Simply describe what you need and Nano Banana Pro creates it with automatic quality review.
actual_capabilities: Generate scientific diagrams from natural language descriptions
Create publication-ready images for journals, posters, and presentations
Automatic quality review using Gemini 3 Pro AI
Smart iterative refinement that stops when quality meets thresholds
Support for CONSORT flowcharts, neural networks, pathways, and circuits
limitations: Requires an OpenRouter API key for AI generation
Generates PNG images only (not vector formats)
Costs apply per generation based on API usage

use_cases.title: Create journal figures
use_cases.description: Generate CONSORT flowcharts, methodology diagrams, and neural network architectures for academic publications.

use_cases.title: Illustrate thesis diagrams
use_cases.description: Create pathway diagrams, system architectures, and process flowcharts for dissertations and coursework.

use_cases.title: Design poster visuals
use_cases.description: Produce clear pathway diagrams, signaling cascades, and experimental setups for conference presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: CONSORT flowchart showing screening (n=500), exclusion (n=150), randomization (n=350), and final analysis groups

prompt_templates.title: Neural Network
prompt_templates.prompt: Transformer encoder-decoder architecture with multi-head attention, cross-attention connections, and layer normalization

prompt_templates.title: Pathway
prompt_templates.prompt: MAPK signaling pathway: EGFR receptor â†’ RAS â†’ RAF â†’ MEK â†’ ERK â†’ nucleus with phosphorylation labels

prompt_templates.title: Circuit
prompt_templates.prompt: Operational amplifier circuit with feedback resistor, input capacitor, and power supply connections labeled

output_examples.input: Create a CONSORT participant flow diagram for a clinical trial with 500 screened, 150 excluded, and 350 randomized into treatment and control groups
output: Visual flowchart with boxes for each study phase
Arrows showing participant flow between phases
Quality score and review log with critique

best_practices: Be specific about layout (top-to-bottom, left-to-right) and include all relevant details like sample sizes
Mention visual requirements such as color preferences, label placement, and style preferences
Choose the appropriate document type (journal, poster, presentation) to set correct quality thresholds
Review the quality score and critique in the JSON log to understand how to improve future generations
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts like 'make a flowchart' instead of describing specific content and layout
Forgetting to specify document type which affects quality thresholds and API costs
Not reviewing the critique feedback which contains suggestions for improvement
Setting iterations too high when the smart system stops early if quality threshold is met

faq.question: Which AI models does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses Nano Banana Pro for image generation and Gemini 3 Pro for quality review. Both are accessed via OpenRouter API.

faq.question: What document types are supported?
faq.answer: Supported types include journal, conference, thesis, grant, preprint, report, poster, presentation, and default.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, use the Python API in generate_schematic_ai.py or call the CLI scripts from other workflows and automation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: API calls go directly to OpenRouter. No user data is stored. Generated images stay on your local machine.

faq.question: Why did generation fail?
faq.answer: Check your API key is set, verify internet connectivity, and ensure your prompt is specific enough for the AI.

faq.question: How is this different from other diagram tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses AI to generate diagrams from text, unlike template-based tools. It includes automatic quality review and iterative refinement.
